docs.lead_paragraph: I’m eager to cover some curious and less depressing topics here — did you know Asian multi-millionaires are cornering the market on first-growth Bordeaux? — and equally eager to stop throwing mind-numbing numbers around. But as long as those pesky Republicans keep attacking the food supply for low-income people and food safety for all of us, and as long as most Democrats put up toothless defenses instead of actually trying to make things better, I gotta pay attention. If we needed further evidence that the party of “family values” only values wealthy families, we have it now; when these guys say “women and children first,” they mean “first to throw overboard.”

headline.main: No Food Safety in These Numbers

docs.abstract: Cutting the FDA and WIC budgets puts us all at risk.
docs.snippet: Cutting the FDA and WIC budgets puts us all at risk.

headline.seo: Asparagus With Anchovies and Capers - Recipes for Health

docs.snippet: Made with very thin asparagus, this dish is common in Italy and a neighboring region of Croatia, Istria.

docs.lead_paragraph: This is a common springtime dish in Italy and in a neighboring region of Croatia, Istria, where it’s made with wild asparagus that is thinner than a pencil. If you can find thin spears at your farmers’ market, use them. The recipe is inspired by a dish in Carol Field’s "Italy in Small Bites."

docs.lead_paragraph: AileyCamp, a full-scholarship summer day camp with classes in dance technique for urban students, will come to Newark this summer. The announcement was made by officials at Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater, the Newark public schools and the New Jersey Performing Arts Center. The six-week program will be held at the Newark Arts High School, from July 5 to Aug. 12 for 100 middle-school students ages 11-14 from Newark schools. On Aug. 10, the students will perform an original work showcasing their skills at the arts center's Victoria Theater. The camp's classes, which include ballet, modern dance, West African dance and discussions on nutrition and conflict resolution, will be led by Ailey teaching artists with backgrounds in dance and education. The camp in Newark is supported by the Prudential Foundation. It joins nine other Ailey camps that will serve about 1,000 students in cities across the country this summer, including Atlanta, Chicago, Miami and Berkeley, Calif.

headline.main: Ailey Dance Camp Heads to Newark
